attributes.action: Introduce Carbon Tax to pay for Covid19 and transform to a green economy.
attributes.background: A Carbon Tax applied to products & services that release carbon dioxide in their production, use, or disposal. Things that might be low in Carbon Tax would be electric cars or local grown fruit & veg. Gas guzzling cars or processed meat products with plastic packaging would cost a little more.
attributes.additional_details:
The money generated from Carbon Tax would pay the COVID 19 debt mountain and transform to a green economy, revenue to be split 50/50. 

Measures implemented might be to encourage more home working to reduce commuting, which produces Carbon Dioxide, give everyone a free bike to encourage more cycling, give every house with a roof free solar panels and battery storage.  

A refurbishments & building programme of energy-efficient homes and infrastructure could be used to kick start the economy.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321854

attributes.action: Rescue the Economy by creating Green Jobs and scrapping investment in Fossil
attributes.background:
The government should stimulate the economy and halt the destruction of our ecosystem by creating millions of jobs in clean energy and putting carbon emissions into structural decline.

The world only has 6 months left to change the course of the climate crisis, according to the IEA.
attributes.additional_details:
Covid-19 has seen millions thrown into unemployment and at this critical point for the survival of life on earth, we must not look backwards by funding the industries that are destroying it.

The IEA has also stated that targeting green jobs will be more effective than pouring money into the high-carbon economy. Their sustainably recovery plan sets out the potential of 1.9m jobs in building efficiency, 1.1m in wind and solar power, 0.86m in power networks and millions more in other areas.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

attributes.action: Replace the FPTP voting system in general elections with STV.
attributes.background:
The 'winner takes all' nature of the seats means that nearly half of the votes are ignored in many constituencies. This makes the seat distribution not proportional to the vote distribution.

FPTP also results in a two-party system which dissuades many people from voting.
attributes.additional_details:
In the last general election, 44% of the votes were for the conservatives, but they got 56% of the seats. Also, the green party should have got 20 seats but they only got 1. 

STV allows people to vote for who they really want to and not worry about tactical voting, because every vote counts. 

It is disingenuous to say that people are voting on a local scale, because parliament makes the laws for the country which everyone must follow.

The following videos explain why STV is a lot better than FPTP:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s7tWHJfhiyo
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l8XOZJkozfI&t=1s

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300274

attributes.action: Use the Green New Deal to rebuild the economy after the COVID19 crisis/recession
attributes.background: Make the Green New Deal the model to rebuild the UK economy after this crisis. Do this by enacting the current legislation brought forward by Caroline Lucas MP and Clive Lewis MP found here https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/bills/cbill/2017-2019/0365/190365.pdf
attributes.additional_details:
COVID19 demonstrates the fragility of society in times of crisis. Climate change, through food insecurity, water scarcity, climate refugees etc., will create similar but larger crises in the near future.

The previous economic system guaranteed an increase in global temperatures to well above 2°C. Scientists show +2°C is the last point of safety.

COVID-19 shows we can make huge economic & social changes in times of crisis, but the bigger, climate crisis is still ahead. We must change path now.

attributes.action: Commit to a 'Green Recovery' as the coronavirus lockdown eases
attributes.background:
The climate is in crisis. While devastating, the covid-19 pandemic has changed public behaviour in ways which have been beneficial to the environment. 

We would like to see the government use the coronavirus lockdown as a springboard to introduce more climate-positive policies across the board.
attributes.additional_details:
The coronoavirus lockdown has reduced reliance on many industries whose activity is harmful to the climate. 

People have made huge changes to their daily lives during lockdown, for instance becoming used to video conferencing. We have learnt it is not always essential to commute to work, or travel to meetings abroad. 

We would like to see policies encouraging a 'green recovery', with  lasting environmental benefits. Dramatic change is needed, and the country has shown we are capable of it.

attributes.action: Turn all available land over to food production now.
attributes.background: All parks, public green land, and gardens must immediately be converted to food production; vegetable plots, polytunnels and crops, whatever is required to mitigate the likely food shortages.
attributes.additional_details: The fact that the UN is issuing warnings about impending food shortages does not bode well for a country that relies on a huge amount of food imports.

attributes.action: Address the climate emergency with the same urgency as the corona virus
attributes.background: The coronavirus has shown that the world can respond to a global emergency with decisive action. Government should respond effectively to the economic impacts of the coronavirus and the climate emergency at the same time, through large-scale green investment and a rapid shift to a green economy.
attributes.additional_details: The UK as chair of the next UN climate summit is in a pivotal position to bring the world to effective action and must lead by example. The coronavirus crisis provides a unique opportunity for large-scale investment in green energy, housing, transport, technology, education and nature restoration, and for a shift of focus from unsustainable growth to broader wellbeing. Responses to the coronavirus should not prop up high-carbon industries but support a just transition towards a green economy.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to take action to address climate change, but it's not clear what you want the Government to do to achieve this.

You could start a new petition which states more clearly what you want the Government to do to address climate change.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to protect the Environment and support carbon neutral energy alternatives, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300000

We have also published a petition calling on the Government to publish new carbon budgets linked to the Paris Agreement and Climate Change Act, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300178

attributes.action: Automate all national trains, and London Underground trains
attributes.background: Lead the world by investing in the full automation of the entire train network. Do this to increase efficiency, reliability, service standards, safety and frequency of trains whilst reducing costs in the medium to long term.
attributes.additional_details:
The train network relies on fallible train "drivers" being consistently alert & available.
Trains stop at red lights and go at green lights following designated speeds. Proven technology automating more complex vehicles with millions of variables, successfully run in many cities around the world. 
The UK with its proud history of innovation could, with partners, easily automate the entire network making it safer, more efficient, frequent & reliable. 
Tickets cost might reduce.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Automation of train services are a matter for individual operators, not the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Incentivise Landlord to Invest in Green Energy for Their Properties
attributes.background: Provide an incentive to encourage as many UK landlords to move away from the use of fossil fuels, with small incentives to use energy companies who only use renewable energy sources and larger incentives to install solar panels. Further measures could include incentivising electric boilers.
attributes.additional_details: The Climate Crisis is a highly important subject, and while many in the UK do not have the means to make a significant impact. This would help in a significant way towards eliminating fossil fuels from energy production in the UK with how many rented properties there are in the UK. There is need for our government to take real action, and this is just one of many measures that will help to take a step in the right direction towards the 'net-zero' goal.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 

We understand you're concerned about climate change and the role of improvements to rented properties in tackling this, but we're not sure what specific incentives you want to be put in place to encourage landlords to make such improvements.

You could start a new petition explaining specifically what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Release the criteria for a country to be on the green and amber list
attributes.background:
The Government need to release the criteria they use to inform their decisions to move countries to/from the green and amber lists. 
Currently there are 54 countries on the red list, many with figures much lower than those on green and amber.
attributes.additional_details:
As British citizens we are entitled to know the reasoning behind decisions that directly affect us. 
No information has been released as to what the actual criteria for the travel system is, which is causing a lot of confusion and stress. 
Many people are stuck in a cycle of bookings that started prior to the pandemic. By understanding the criteria we can make informed decisions about next steps so that we can look forward to eventually being reunited with loved ones abroad.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: 

Publish criteria for allocating countries to red, amber and green lists:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/587003

attributes.background: We wish to stop all building on the green belt
attributes.additional_details: We believe it is destroying too much habitat for wild life and the country side.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/596243

attributes.background:
As e scooters are illegal 
And they are more efficient to the country 
Why can’t we have a limit on speed then allow them to go in bike lnes.  Already London have scooter trials. But why can’t we take our own scooters. To the roads.  
Helps climate change 
Pollution 
And emissions
attributes.additional_details:
As it will make the planet more green 
And safe. More better London

attributes.action: Regulate the price of expensive PCR tests to a maximum price of £35 or below
attributes.background: Regulate the price of expensive pcr tests
attributes.additional_details:
Travellers returning from countries on the government’s green list, as well as fully vaccinated passengers coming from amber list countries, must currently pay for a PCR test within two days of arriving in the UK. 
Those arriving from amber countries who have not been double-jabbed must pay for tests on days two and eight, as well as quarantining for 10 days upon entry to the UK. 
PCR travel tests, which must be purchased privately from a list of government-approved providers, cost around £75 on average in the UK.

These prices are shown on the gov uk website as low as £20 per test but in actual fact are being charged from £75-£150 per test.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for a similar action: 

Lower the price of the £210 COVID Home Test Kits for travellers entering the UK
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575509

Provide free PCR tests for international travel and return to the UK
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590483

attributes.action: Charge cyclists for reckless endangerment where they refuse to use cycle paths
attributes.background: Use the current Road Safety laws/Road Traffic Act to prosecute cyclists for reckless endangerment when they refuse to use available cycle routes on busy roads. Cycle paths are made available for the benefit of all road users, to reduce risk of injury, reduce congestion and reduce pollution.
attributes.additional_details: A great amount of money has been spent on improving the cycle routes throughout the UK, and many cycle routes now provide better access than by road. Yet many cyclists pay little attention to cycle routes and will refuse to use them even when informed of their presence. The refusal to use available cycle routes creates unnecessary danger, unnecessary congestion and unnecessary pollution. One cyclist can cause miles of traffic (destroying green benefits) and huge hindrance to emergency services.

rejection.details:
Decisions about investigating alleged offences and prosecuting these are a matter for the police and Crown Prosecution Service, not the Government or House of Commons.

You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/593714

attributes.action: Allow fully vaccinated non-residents to enter the UK without quarantine
attributes.background: Extend the quarantine exemption to include anyone that has been fully vaccinated with an approved jab, including British citizens vaccinated abroad and people of all nationalities and countries of residence, provided they are arriving from green or amber list countries.
attributes.additional_details:
Fully vaccinated UK residents are already allowed to enter the country without quarantining, provided they arrive from green or amber list countries.

But British people living abroad, and fully vaccinated people from other countries, still have to quarantine - even if the vaccines they've had are the same as the ones being given in the UK. 

This is discrimination, and it's keeping families and loved ones apart.

The protective effect of a vaccine is the same regardless of where you come from.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Scrap quarantine for vaccinated people arriving in the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575612

Allow ALL vaccinated British Expats to visit the UK without quarantining: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/585438

attributes.action: Help businesses make their green energy contribution.
attributes.background: Review the way the local councils deal with green energy planning applications such as wind and solar power. At present, local businesses are having their green energy applications denied, without reasonable cause. Ensure businesses green energy applications are fairly reviewed.
attributes.additional_details: Take away the green energy planning control from local councils, in an effort to help businesses save our planet.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about planning decisions for green energy projects being denied, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. You've said you want the planning process to change, but it's not clear what changes you want to be made to this process.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, we could accept a petition calling for all planning decisions regarding green energy projects to be made by central government, rather than local government.

attributes.action: Green list approval for EU countries with biggest immigration percentage in UK
attributes.background: Consider of adding on the green list countries with highest percentage of immigrants in order to allow them visit families and home.
attributes.additional_details:
An estimated 3.6 million EU born citizens have lived in the UK (2019) There is a minimum of 313,000 people that have arrived to the UK with intentions of staying a minimum of 12 months in 2020. 
Over 6% of British population isn’t able to see family for nearly 2 years. Most of them were unable to say last goodbye to family members. That’s why I’m kindly asking you to consider EU countries with low new coronavirus cases such as Poland to the green list as you did with a lot holiday destinations

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see changes to which EU countries are on the green list for international travel, but we're not sure which countries you want to be added to the list, or what formula you want the Government to use to decide what countries to add.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Add Poland to the green list for international travel: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590080

attributes.action: To Put pakistan 🇵🇰 on the Green list of countries and territories
attributes.background: We would like the government to put Pakistan on the Green list just like the other countries that were added on the 24th of June 2021. We want government NOT to treat Pakistan as Indian region. Pakistan has controlled covid situation well and low rate of covid cases it self a biggest evidence..
attributes.additional_details: We want Pakistan on the Green list because data show low rates cases and deaths. Government of Pakistan are controlling their borders really well with India  . Many people want to go to Pakistan for a holiday, see parents and loved ones. As Pakistan is controlling the pandemic well, having to keep Pakistan on red list is unfair and no longer being justified. Don’t treat Pakistan same as India as prime minister Imran Khan has managed covid situation way better than many advance countries.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581974

attributes.action: Change the quarantine enforcement on anyone traveling if a negative test present
attributes.background: Cancel the quarantine enforcement for anyone traveling from Amber or Green countries if a negative test is present;No self isolation if a negative test is presented within the 72h on returning to UK. Tests should be made affordable for everyone! Positive test result =quarantine; negative=green line
attributes.additional_details: Not everyone can afford to take unpaid leave to cover a few days away and to quarantine on their arrival back in UK, and pay for tests on arrival in UK, day 2, day 8!! People are restricted from seeing their families abroad!A negative test should allow them to safely see their families! The aviation sector is being completely ruined! People are being affected on their mental health for not being able to travel to see their loved ones. Negative test result should give you the right to travel!

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about arrangements for people returning to the UK, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Your petition says people should not need to quarantine if they provide a negative Covid-19 test within 72 hours, but it's not clear if you think people should be required to self-isolate until they provide a negative a test.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Allow vaccinated passengers to travel to the U.K. without having to quarantine
attributes.background: We want the government to allow fully vaccinated passengers to travel to the U.K. without having to quarantine regardless of their port of origin (Like green destinations are able to do)
attributes.additional_details:
The traffic light system assesses the covid risk of countries but doesn’t take into account vaccinated individuals. 
Most of Europe is now allowing quarantine free travel for anyone who is vaccinated, regardless of their port of origin. The travel industry is in chaos and needs support. It is the only way to recover the industry. It also gives an incentive to get the vaccine. 

We want quarintine free travel (like the green destinations) for anyone who has been fully vaccinated against covid 19

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575612

attributes.action: Allow UK people to see their families in Europe without prohibitive testing cost
attributes.background: The current Covid rules mean that people that wish to visit their families in the EU face prohibitive costs. For example a family of 5 requires 1500 pounds worth of tests in total, which is unaffordable for most. Many adults and children have not seen their families in the EU for up to two years.
attributes.additional_details:
We are campaigning for a solution to remove these prohibitive testing costs for people's.
This could include: 
1. Creating a vaccine certificate compatible with the EU green card system, which Norway, Switzerland and Iceland have pledged to do.
2. Removing the need for expensive testing for children and vaccinated adults, for example by using the cheaper lateral flow test.
 3. Allowing free NHS tests for those travelling to see family in Europe.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Introduce a 'Vaccination Passport' for international travel: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574479

Lower the price of the £210 COVID Home Test Kits for travellers entering the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575509

Make Covid-19 tests freely available to all international travellers at airports: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586262

Exempt vaccinated people from PCR test requirement when travelling to England: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/586189

attributes.action: Remove the UAE from the UK's Red List
attributes.background: Arabian Business is urging for a review of the data ahead of the next available decision on the UK's Green, Amber and Red List. We ask you to remove the UAE from the Red List to allow travel, both for British citizens wanting visit loved ones, and for business and tourism travel to resume.
attributes.additional_details:
The UAE is one of the world’s leading vaccinators.

As of May 16, new cases of coronavirus in the country fell to just 1,251, while the number of vaccines doses administered rose to 11,450,769, with a rate of 115.78 doses per 100 people.

Plus, a new report places the UAE as the second-most pandemic resilient country in the world. The Pandemic Resilience Index ranked 40 countries on factors including vaccination approval dates, vaccination drives, critical care bed capacity and mass testing.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

To remove the UAE off the ‘Red List’ by the Summer
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/575787

attributes.action: Stop the proposed Westley Green development from gaining planning permission
attributes.background: A new garden city is proposed at Six Mile Bottom, Cambridgeshire and the surrounding area. 8,500 new houses would be built on 1,350 acres of farmland. We do not want our village to be developed into a town, we chose to live in a quiet rural area, with thriving wildlife and historical buildings.
attributes.additional_details: The increase in traffic and proposed metro link would be detrimental to the wildlife, regardless of the efforts to make this a 'green' town. Many of us, having lived here for decades, would feel pushed out of our homes as it would not be the place we loved and recognised anymore.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Planning decisions are the responsibility of local councils.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Every house should have a solar panel by the end of 2025
attributes.background: I want the government to make a law on using solar panels on the roof of most if not all houses to stop green house gasses
attributes.additional_details: It turns out that 25% of global warming happens because of our electric. This is a massive problem as the earth is supposed to warm up 1 degree in about 5000 years instead of 20 and if we don’t act now 60% of all living creatures including plants will die in about 60 or so years and this will cause a mass extinction. Thank you

rejection.details:
It's not clear whether your petition relates to new or existing properties, or both, but the Government is only responsible for setting rules for new build properties, and adaptions to existing properties. The Government would not therefore mandate that solar panels need to be installed on existing properties.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign: 

Make it law for all new builds to include green energy solutions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332338

You could start a petition calling on the Government to provide funding for installation of solar panels on existing residential properties, if that is something you want to happen.

attributes.action: Replace  key Chinese imports with home-grown products to alleviate unemployment
attributes.background: Start a program to replace products we import from China by creating new, clean, green industries in the UK. This needs to be run in parallel with a training and apprenticeship program to improve the skill-base of the young people who are unemployed due to Covid & improve the balance of payments.
attributes.additional_details: Set up a Project team to analyse the Chinese imports data and set up a few pilot projects to replace certain chosen products with home-grown ones. They will of course be made in new, green, reduced carbon businesses.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a decision for UK manufacturers and consumers, not the UK Government and Parliament.

attributes.action: Include a Low Covid Alert Level & Removal of Restrictions in the Tiered System.
attributes.background: We call on Government to make the lifting of restrictions and a return to normal social interactions a focus, goal and integral part of the new tiered system. Furthermore we demand that all levels and restrictions are based on a thorough, risk/benefit analysis made widely available to all citizens.
attributes.additional_details:
A positive end goal will aid mental health and help everyone to focus on overcoming the virus. A green light means 'safe to go'. We do not want the rule of six to stand for safe or normal. 
Covid 19 is a risk, yet restrictions also carry a risk to livelihoods, mental & physical health. Using clear parameters to trigger tiers when the risks of Covid are higher than the risks of restrictions would allow people to view the situation logically and encourage the following of well-founded guidelines.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to change its approach to Covid-19, but it's not clear if you want the Government to introduce a new "low" alert level where Covid-19 restrictions would not apply, or if you want all restrictions in the new system to be removed.

If you want the Government to easy Covid-19 restrictions, you might like to sign the following petitions:

End COVID-19 social distancing: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320079

Lift local lockdowns and Covid-19 restrictions in England: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551469

If you want the Government to introduce a new "low" alert level, we could accept a petition about this, but it would need to be clear what this would look like.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 16 for mayoral elections and London Assembly
attributes.background: 16 and 17 year olds are currently not allowed to vote in any UK elections in England, but this must change. Allowing 16 and 17 year olds to vote in mayoral elections would mean we can be part of the democratic processes that our country is built on, and we can have a say in how our cities are run.
attributes.additional_details:
16 and 17 year olds would be able to properly get involved in politics, and hold parties to account in terms of policies that matter most to us.
I am a 16 year old member of the Green Party of England and Wales, but I could not vote for them in the 2019 General Election, and will not be able to in the 2021 London Mayoral Election unless there is change. There are many teens like me who are already politically involved, and many more who would follow politics more if they could vote and be heard.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions instead:

Fair and Equal voting rights for young people across the UK: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318810

Extend the franchise (voting age) to include those who are 16-17 years old: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300596

attributes.action: Prioritise a green transformation in the COVID-19 economic recovery plan
attributes.background:
People want an urgent response to the climate emergency. We have now seen that rapid action in times of crisis is possible. 

Let’s use the COVID-19 pandemic as a turning point in climate action, combining economic recovery with sustainable climate policy. 

The time for action is now.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the government to step up their commitment to people and our environment.

The evidence is clear: implementing green policies is the best way to revive the economy and tackle climate change.

With all of our futures thrown into question by the pandemic, now is the best time to re-prioritise and build back better.

We’ve consolidated expert research on the most impactful measures to achieve a sustainable and thriving economy. 

Visit: Peoplesplan.org

You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317343

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

attributes.action: COVID-19 economic rescue plans must be green
attributes.background:
Coronavirus and climate change are the biggest challenges facing a generation.

Emergency financing must be used to build a sustainable economy which supports our health and wellbeing and drives growth, providing new jobs and opportunities across the UK for our generation and those of the future.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2019, Parliament declared a climate change emergency. 

The government committed to net-zero carbon emissions by 2050, pledging investment in clean energy solutions and green infrastructure and forecasting that the low carbon economy ‘could grow 11 per cent per year between 2015 and 2030, four times faster than the projected growth of the economy as a whole’.

The government must invest emergency funds in green and reproductive sectors including health, social care and public services.

attributes.action: Issue ULEZ Charge notice before issuing a penalty for failure to pay.
attributes.background: I want the parliament to advice the government to introduce a Green Zone Charge notice. Individuals should be made aware and given enough time to make payments. Penalties should only be issued if a person intentionally refuses to pay the charges after receiving a letter of notification.
attributes.additional_details: The ULEZ charge is a relatively new government scheme that most people in the UK don't know about, nor understand how it works. Especially people from rural areas, based on my survey. There is a three days window to pay the charge. Failure to do so will result to a penalty whether you are notified or not you have such a charge. This approach penalizes people who are unfamiliar with these recent innovations and leads to unnecessary financial stress and pressure.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about clean air zones, however it's not clear if you want changes to be made to how drivers are charged through the ULEZ scheme, which is specific to London, or in a Clean Air Zone in another area. 

In any case, decisions about how to charge drivers under a Clean Air Zone are a matter for the relevant 'charging authority', such as a local council, not the UK Government or House of Commons.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Finance completion of the Metropolitan Line Extension to Watford Junction.
attributes.background: To provide funds for, and instruct TfL and Network Rail to expedite, construction of the Metropolitan Line Extension over the nearby closed Croxley Green route to Watford High Street and Watford Junction.
attributes.additional_details:
This connection will provide a direct link to the mainline railway network for residents along the Metropolitan Line, and the Chiltern Railways route from Marylebone to Aylesbury.  Currently any passengers needing access to the West Coast Main Line must travel into London and use Euston or Euston Square Underground stations.  This is a long and unnecessary journey.

Moreover, the Croxley Link, AKA the Metropolitan Line Extension will integrate, and provide a central interchange for, all railway services in the Three Rivers area.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. It is the responsibility of Transport for London, the Mayor of London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

Establish a planning ombudsman as arbiter.
attributes.additional_details: A developer's appeal to build houses in a green field enclave within an AONB was upheld by the Planning Inspectorate, with scant regard to the town's NDP and despite the fact that: quotas for new homes had already been exceeded; the land in question is prone to flooding, and that road access to the site is inherently unsafe.  Another planned development of tightly-packed urban-style housing within an AONB failed to take into account the existing landscape, with dispersed forest smallholdings.

attributes.action: Set up drone ports so hedgehogs can safely cross the M25
attributes.background: Set up strategically located drone ports, so that hedgehogs can be safely transported across the M25 motorway. Too many hedgehogs are needlessly losing their lives every year as they are killed attempting to cross this busy highway. This must be brought to an immediate end.
attributes.additional_details: With the rollout of 5G, AI and smart technology, we now have the ability to set up autonomous drone ports. These could be remotely controlled and allow hedgehogs to be safely flown across the M25 in drones, so that they are unharmed. It is unacceptable that every year thousands of hedgehogs are being squashed on our public roads. They deserve better. Britain should be at the forefront of animal welfare, and this is a safe and green method to enable their secure passage across the M25.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the ability of hedgehogs to safely cross motorways, but we're not sure exactly how what you're proposing would work, or who could be given responsibility for this. Highways England is responsible for the operation, maintenance and improvement of England's motorways and major A roads, but isn't responsible for transporting wildlife across the road network.

attributes.additional_details:

Many people are unconvinced by proposals to turn Britain carbon neutral and would prefer to have their say on the issue.  After hearing debates from both sides of the argument on Climate Change, we would then ask for a Referendum on how we proceed in making Britain greener

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Allow Parish Councils to contest approved Green Belt Planning Applications.
attributes.background: I want Parliament to devolve more powers to Parish Councils to contest Planning Applications approved by Local Councils which are made on Green Belt land.
attributes.additional_details: Parish Councils should have the right to challenge planning decisions that involve the removal of Green Belt land. Whilst there is a need for housing the pressure that large building companies put on Local Councils is immense. NPPF guidelines state that building on Green Belt land should only be done in "Exceptional Circumstances". This is not always the case. But at present there is no legislation for Parish Councils to appeal.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about planning applications for development on green belt land, however parish councils are already statutory consultees for planning decisions, meaning the local authority must consult parish councils on all planning applications in their area including those relating to green belt land. Furthermore, anyone can appeal a planning decision once it has been made, including parish councils. It is therefore not clear what it is you'd like the Government to change about how the system currently operates. 

You could have a petition calling on the Government to change the National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) to require local authorities to obtain parish council approval before granting planning permission for developments on green belt land, if that is something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Provide an enforceable global protocol for "green channel" travel for seafarers
attributes.background: Mariners worldwide deliver 80% of trade and are crucial to the supply chain. Countries have closed their borders, flights stopped and extremely taxing rules put in place for any travel. We need a global enforceable green channel protocol for mariners and the facilitation of health care in ports.
attributes.additional_details: This is so that seafarers can travel and embark and disembark their ships internationally.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see the Government seek to agree a global protocol for seafarers, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like this protocol to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
